conclusion: The question asks for the output power and total power of the power source when connected to a small light bulb.
The graph shows a straight line A representing the U-I graph of the power source and a curve B representing the U-I graph of the small light bulb.
The intersection point of line A and curve B determines the operating point of the circuit.
The intersection point is at approximately U = 2V and I = 2A.
Output power of the power source is calculated as P = U * I = 2V * 2A = 4W.
Total power of the power source is given as 6W.
The output power of the power source is 4W, and the total power of the power source is 6W.
